page.title: 18ECOLOGY
page.content: Clyst St Lawerence is a small village on the outskirts of Clyst Hydon.It has a church which is probably Norman.The coat of arms is Charles the second. There is a painting opposite the coat of arms is interesting and maybe the only one in Devon.Walkey's cottage is next to the church.This cottage was bought for Charles Edward Walkey who was the coachman for the Reverent at the time.In the church there are the graves of the family of the coachman. The Old Rectory which is opposite the church and is about eight hundred years old and used to be owned by the Reverent.There is a legend to be a secret passage leading from the church to Upton farm.For Upton farm used to be owned by a group of monks who when they went to church they did not like to be seen so they dug a tunnel as the legend says.
